comments.body: We can already shoot Fireworks with the crossbows.
i like the idea. i had the same idea(sort of)
Maybe an explosive block damaging firework rocket
ya but fireworks barely do any damage
I love the idea and would so like it to be in minecraft, hope I excited for first half of cliffs and caves update on tuesday ✌️
this is a good idea but if this did happen there would be more than this
I was just thinking about this. A good idea to get the inside texture blocks. Maybe stripping the blocks would make them drop a mushroom depending on the mushroom block you strip
Yes! That would make obtaining these blocks much easier! Also, I'd like that If you Silk Touch a stripped mushroom block you can get it in your inventory

I am working on a large build that i intend to build on a survival server that uses a lot of stripped mushroom blocks & while sketching in creative i found that the stripped mushroom blocks are not in the creative inventory, you cant block select them, you can't use /give command to get them & you cant silk touch them either!?.

Building with them in creative is a pain in itself as you have to either use another mushroom block to strip them then remove the mushroom block you used to strip it or use the debug stick which again involves more needless clicking & time wasting.

Using stripped mushroom blocks to build with in creative is frustrating & takes more time than it really should so you can imagine what it's like trying to build with stripped mushroom blocks in survival.

Giving players some way of crafting stripped mushroom blocks would be great & since axes can already strip logs using axes to strip mushroom block seems the most logical & intuitive way.
the side you use the axe on should determine what side gets stripped

I came to the website to post this, glad to see someone else already had the idea. Let's hope this can be a thing. Mushroom blocks need to be able to share their hidden texture with the world of builders.

Support, using an axe on a mushroom block should apply the pores/sponge/inside texture on all 6 sides, and this "stripped" mushroom block should retain its state when mined with a Silk Touch axe, instead of reverting to a regular mushroom block-

I really think you are like a lot of personn i'm using a ressource pack to change the terracota block to have a texture for each rotation that me to add more roofing block but the problem is that i love the terracota texture and it's sad to change it because we don't have proper roof tiles block.

Here an example of  the mod "not enough roof" to show what i could look like (maybe with the stair model to simplify the creation of it)

and an image of the mod more materials mods to show the wheat block stairs
Just heck yes!

I strongly agree with this, with the next update supposed to be about expressing ourselves, adding in a way to properly put a roof on to our builds would be amazing.. it sucks to always have to turn to mods to be able to do some things that should just seem obvious.
Considering how far Minecraft has come, a collection of different roofing materials would be a nice addition to the game
The freezing enchantement shouldn’t stop the player but slow it for ten second and give 4 extra damage and shouldn’t be stronger on the trident but on the axe
Yes yes i lke this

I was thinking that the freeze enchantment should be exclusive to snowballs. Throwing a snowball at a mob would slow/stop a mob for a set amount of time.

 

Now there will be three tiers of feeze enchantments

Freeze 1: STOPS the mob from moving and animating for 15 seconds.

Freeze 2: Stops the mob for 30 seconds and gives damage to the mob/player by taking two hearts from the mob. Slashing them with a sword takes 1 - 3 heart damage from mob without enchantments.

Freeze 3: 45 seconds

Freeze 4: 60 seconds

 

Now if a player is hit with the freeze enchanted snowball, he would need to rapidly fire his main hand (used to attack mobs) to wear off the effects quicker. Now doing this would cut off the effect by 2 seconds every rapid fire until the effects wear out then the player can move freely again.

(This would be good for mobs that fall from the sky and break in pieces)
This could become a good combat strategy.
add it my anarchy server would love it

Perfect for a trident! I think now that powdewred snow exists with the freezing effect, if freezing is added to a trident the freeezing damage can set in; it can act as a sort of fire aspect equivalent to tridents but retain the water theme of a trident.
It's like Slowness

Eh, you're going to have to give a better reason than "it could charge redstone" (redstone in its current form doesn't need to be charged) and "it would be good for trolling" (because we need features implemented just to let people troll people... -.- )
I think a lightning rod would attract any lightning that strikes in that chunk of the world (16 x 16 area). Also this could be used for a charged creeper farm.
I think that it should be two iron bars on top of each other with nothing above or next to it, if it is added.

Placed in a village (and spawned atop a "church" structure) any lightning that would spawn within the village hits the lightning rod instead. This would prevent villagers from turning to witches (and the loss of an important villager). Lightning is one reason among many you do NOT let villagers "roam free". The only way to keep your villagers alive and useful is to enslave and imprison them. This is silly. A "lightning rod" that spawns with the "church" (and not all villages spawn with a church) would go a long way towards the dream of "free range villagers" with the 1.14 update.
wow, now this is an actual feature.
I like the idea of an item which can give you more inventory space!
Saddle bags for a donkey.
I like your idea, Baggins of Baggend. Although it's creative, it wouldn't work because chests already function like saddle bags. That doesn't mean I don't like it, because I do.
Pocket
I'm sure if minecraft actually did add this, they would think of a better use for it
Id say that it would open a whole new realm for trolling too, but as an idea it IS worth advancing

This seems too dangerous for any world that still has fire spread...  I do like the idea of an arrow from a flame bow being able to light a nether portal.  But lighting actual fires in the world is just too dangerous.
Hmm. I'd prefer a bow made with blaze rods instead of sticks, that consumes blaze powder instead of arrows, and shoots blaze fireballs instead of arrows.
The flame arrow should be made of blaze rods and string
maybe not such a large radius, maybe only the block that it hit
So do you mean you could use any dye as the enchanting catalyst, or do you mean that after the tool is enchanted, you put it in the table with a dye again?
@Max I mean instead of having to use lapis. You can still use lapis for a dark blue shimmer, but to get one that looks like the one we have currently you would only use cyan dye, no lapis needed.
I like the idea of adding a spot in the crafting table to put a die, it would give a new level to enchanted armor, such as being able to make a team of all of a certain color or something.
Maybe this could be a function of the smithing table
I like the idea of using the smithing table.  if you make it so you don't need lapis you take away it's entire purpose in the game.  Also, you take away some of the challenge of enchanting.

Maybe right click the enchantment table with a dye? Then, we'd need the enchantment catalyst as well. (Also, this would tint the book on top.) 

EDIT: Replace "click an ench" with "click the ench"

No.  I think it would be a good Idea to leave the enchantment table alone altogether.  Also I don't think it should be that cheep.  make it so you need to combine the dye with an item like dragons breath.  Then put the special dye in a crafting table with the item you want to use it on.

Using the new drop item from the glow squid from the newest snapshot (at the time) and mixing that with a dye and your tool of choice into the ‘smithing table’ could change the enchantment glow, would be a cool new feature
Yes please. Enchanted armour looks terrible

Combining dragons breath, glow ink sac and any color in the crafting table could make a color pellet which could be used in the smithing table to recolor any existing armor or tool enchantment. This update wouldn't only be visual because for example sometimes I accidentally use silk touch pickaxe to mine deepslate when I were in need of gobbled deepslate. This happens even though I have named my picks. Were the picks slightly different color I wouldn't ever need to mine my deepslate twice.

Uh, did you not know that almost all dispensable items can just be used on their own? Simply hold the item and press use. Arrows require holding a bow instead (and provide much greater effect). The other thing you can't do is to equip other players, which probably should not be made easier.

@SpecialisTol

This is a wonderful idea, being able to spam short-ranged, lower-damage arrows would be amazing, as would getting the ability to finally shoot fire charges yourself.

Great idea - we had a similar idea when we were playing multiplayer. Being able to sleep on longer adventures away from a home base would be very useful. Could still do the normal checks like not being able to sleep if there are monsters near etc., so a player may need to set up a temporary camp/safe spot to roll the sleeping bag out.
I'd like to sleep without taking my respawn location with me, I'd even accept durability of the sleeping bag.
Might require a campfire (stove) and also require a large "You can't sleep while there are monsters" range.
Can you give some details on both of them please

Just an update idea, but maybe use the Blast Furnace to turn Copper and Tin ingots or nuggets into Softened Iron Ingots/Nuggets and Softened Tim Ingots/Nuggets. Then I swing the Anvil, squish one Softened Iron with one Softened Tin to make two Bronze Ingots.

The cost to craft should be 1 lantern surrounded by 4 glass panes to create 1 coloured lantern.

The colour of the glass would determine the light colour it emits. By giving players different coloured lanterns we could use that lighting in creative atmospheric builds. For example, red lighting effects in a hellish dungeon or warm yellow in a beach-side house. 

Upgrade the soul lantern to have soul particle effects slowly emitting from it and give it a slightly darker metal frame. This would separate it from the other normal coloured lanterns.
I don't think that chariots were pulled by 4 or 10 horses. The max back in the day was 2 per chariot.
Yeah, I agree with steeldoge about max number of animals. Still an amazing idea. Maybe in a distant future we could even see villagers travelling in these, though I think it's less likely.
A little less animals needed for some maybe?

I love ❤️ this idea, because it would help me transport resources across several maps in the realm that I share with my friends & family. However, I don’t think that animals pulling a wagon or cart should result in moving slowly for those animals.

I think for dogs we should have different breeds and also sleep roam around lay down fetch sit and follow you also dogs when you tame them you can pick they’re breed, personality and choose who they breed with and feed dogs with and they don’t go and breed right away and they can actually eat and drink but if they don’t eat in 5 Minecraft days then they die and so as water and walks and fetch etc and better mods on bedrock also I think we have palm trees and of course more animals and can bedrock ride polar bears like Java also add grizzly bears and black bears and can we actually feed and breed bears, black bears and polar bears if you are reading this hopefully I have good enough reasons and if this gets added thank you so much🤗🥳

Maybe you'd have to craft it using netherite instead of wood, making it harder to get, and copper wire instead of string
This could even just be a normal bow that you attach a telescope to in the crafting menu, It doesn't have to be a new weapon. This could also attach to the crossbow as well.

Imagine if you could play the goat horn and the sound could be heard for many blocks. In multiplayer that could be pretty cool like if your house is getting raided you can play the horn and your friends can come to help you out.
Makeing a raid horn sound

Maybe for functionality purposes, your horse, or donkey, for example could teleport to you, or run towards you. If it's in a stable, it will stop trying to run towards you after 2 minutes, as it can't go anywhere. Maybe even call your wolves too, if they are far away and sitting.
Horns that you could wear on your character would be awesome 0.0

It makes sense, but I'm personally against this. All 5 main weapons have features that distinguish them from the others:

1. Swords (as they are now): Looting, sweeping attack

2. Axes: Shield-disabling, utility as a tool

3. Tridents: Short-range + long-range combo, Riptide, Channeling

4. Bows: Infinity, extreme damage per hit

5. Crossbows: Piercing, Multishot, firework-firing

If axes gain Looting, then sword use becomes less incentivized. Furthermore, axes already have the major advantage that they can be used as a tool.
This is a great idea 👍

Sharpness and smite are unique to swords and axes, so it doesn't make sense that looting isn't also compatible. Looting is a melee weapon enchant so it should be compatible an anvil. Similar to how you don't see sharpness or smite in the enchantment table with an axe. Also it doesn't make the sword obsolete since sweeping edge is the go to for using looting when farming mobs where it is most useful and the sword has highest dps which is why it's my go to in combat.

When you play in the world for a long time, it's not very convenient when you have a lot of tools before you could enchant an axe for prey, but now you can't why? So you can use an axe as a weapon very conveniently and mobs die from the first blow.
